item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 2:35 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (820 points | 256 comments)
2. Faster CRDTs (2021) (184 points | 51 comments)
3. Rerun: Visualize Multimodal Data over Time (28 points | 1 comment)
4. A Collection of Free Public APIs That Is Tested Daily (260 points | 58 comments)
5. The Monospace Web (239 points | 56 comments)
6. Obsolete Command-Line Tools of Linux (8 points | 8 comments)
7. Sainsbury Wing contractors find 1990 letter from donor (265 points | 70 comments)
8. Blitzortung – real time lightning strikes around the world (162 points | 61 comments)
9. Taskwarrior – CLI Task Management (81 points | 26 comments)
10. ChartDB – Free and open source, database design editor (25 points | 4 comments)
11. Knockknock: Simple, secure, and stealthy port knocking implementation (17 points | 9 comments)
12. KLEE Symbolic Execution Engine (47 points | 8 comments)
13. Slime mold simulation in Rust using WASM and WebGPU (24 points | 3 comments)
14. How Chrome Accessibility Works (37 points | 9 comments)
15. DisTrO – a family of low latency distributed optimizers (64 points | 22 comments)
16. Launch HN: Bucket Robotics (YC S24) – Defect detection for molded and cast parts (82 points | 19 comments)
17. EasyPost (YC S13) Is Hiring ( | hide)
18. Vulnerabilities show why STARTTLS should be avoided if possible (2021) (68 points | 37 comments)
19. The Simple Algorithm That Ants Use to Build Bridges (2018) (55 points | 12 comments)
20. Anthropic publishes the 'system prompts' that make Claude tick (355 points | 228 comments)
21. Rustproofing Linux (Part 1/4 Leaking Addresses) (2023) (60 points | 11 comments)
22. If Your World Is Not Enchanted, You're Not Paying Attention (63 points | 53 comments)
23. Splatt3R: Zero-Shot Gaussian Splatting from Uncalibrated Image Pairs (117 points | 24 comments)
24. PyRoboCOP: Python-Based Robotic Control and Optimization Package (21 points | 1 comment)
25. A New Wave of Underwater Comms Is Coming (48 points | 17 comments)
26. Zuckerberg claims regret on caving to White House pressure on content (475 points | 870 comments)
27. Malware infiltrates Pidgin messenger's official plugin repository (142 points | 13 comments)
28. Clay (short for C Layout) is a high performance 2D UI layout library (191 points | 81 comments)
29. Hackers infect ISPs with malware that steals customers' credentials (41 points | 15 comments)
30. The Triple Failure of 2U, EdX, and Axim (227 points | 166 comments)
